text: The European Half Marathon Cup is a quadrennial team marathon competition between European countries held for the first time in 2016, incorporated in the half marathon events of the European Athletics Championships. ==Editions== {| class="wikitable" width=50% style="font-size:100%; text-align:center;" |- bgcolor=#CCDDEE ! Year ! Edition ! City ! Country ! Date ! Men ! Women |- | 2016 | 1st | align=left|Amsterdam | align=left| | 10 July | | |- | 2020 | 2nd | align=left|Paris | align=left| | | | |} ==Medals== In italic the participants whose result did not go into the team's total time, but awarded with medals. ===Men=== {| |- | align=center|2016 | valign=top align="left"| Switzerland Tadesse Abraham Julien Lyon Adrian Leman Christian Kreienbühl Marcel Bernie Andreas Kempf | valign=top align="left"| Spain Carles Castillejo Jesús España Ayad Lamdassem Ivan Fernandez | valign=top align="left"| Italy Daniele Meucci Stefano La Rosa Ruggero Pertile Xavier Chevrier Daniele D'Onofrio |} ===Women=== {| |- | align=center|2016 | valign=top align="left"| Portugal Sara Moreira Jessica Augusto Dulce Félix Marisa Barros Vanessa Fernandes | valign=top align="left"| Italy Veronica Inglese Anna Incerti Rosaria Console Laila Soufyane Catherine Bertone | valign=top align="left"| Turkey Esma Aydemir Sultan Haydar Sevilay Eytemiş Tubay Erdal Yasemin Can Meryem Erdoğan |} == All-time medal table == ==See also== * European Marathon Cup * European Athletics Championships ==References== ==External links== * EAA web site Category:European Athletic Association competitions Category:Recurring sporting events established in 2016 Category:Half marathons
title: European Half Marathon Cup
